field.label: Role
field.help: Define the role of this instance.

field.label: Description
field.help: You may enter a description here for your reference (not parsed).

field.label: Protocol
field.help: Use protocol for communicating with remote host.

field.label: Port number
field.help: Port number to use. Defaults to 1194 when in server role or when client mode specifies a bind address, or nobind when client does not have a specific bind address.

field.label: Bind address
field.help: Optional IP address for bind. If specified, OpenVPN will bind to this address only. If unspecified, OpenVPN will bind to all interfaces.

field.label: Type
field.help: Choose the type of tunnel, OSI Layer 3 [tun] is the most common option to route IPv4 or IPv6 traffic, [tap] offers Ethernet 802.3 (OSI Layer 2) connectivity between hosts and is usually combined with a bridge. DCO is a faster Layer 3 implementation, but has some additional constraints.

field.label: Verbosity
field.help: Output verbosity level (0..9)

field.label: Concurrent connections
field.help: Specify the maximum number of clients allowed to concurrently connect to this server.

field.label: Keep alive interval
field.help: Ping interval in seconds. 0 to disable keep alive

field.label: Keep alive timeout
field.help: Causes OpenVPN to restart after n seconds pass without reception of a ping or other packet from remote.

field.label: Server (IPv4)
field.help: This directive will set up an OpenVPN server which will allocate addresses to clients out of the given network/netmask. The server itself will take the .1 address of the given network for use as the server-side endpoint of the local TUN/TAP interface

field.label: Server (IPv6)
field.help: This directive will set up an OpenVPN server which will allocate addresses to clients out of the given network/netmask. The server itself will take the next base address (+1) of the given network for use as the server-side endpoint of the local TUN/TAP interface

field.label: Bridge gateway
field.help: This directive will set up an OpenVPN server which will allocate addresses to clients out of the given network pool.

field.label: Bridge DHCP pool
field.help: Specify an ip range which should be used to offer IPv4 addresses to the client.

field.label: Topology
field.help: Configure virtual addressing topology when running in --dev tun mode. This directive has no meaning in --dev tap mode, which always uses a subnet topology.

field.label: Remote
field.help: Remote host name or IP address with optional port, examples: my.remote.local dead:beaf:: my.remote.local:1494 [dead:beaf::]:1494 192.168.1.1:1494

field.label: Depend on (CARP)
field.help: The CARP VHID to depend on. When this virtual address is not in master state, then the instance will be shutdown.

field.label: Certificate
field.help: Select a certificate to use for this service.

field.label: Verify Remote Certificate
field.help: Require that the peer certificate was signed with an explicit "key usage" and "extended key usage" based on RFC 3280 rules. This is a useful security option for both servers and clients. For clients, to ensure that the host they connect to is a designated server; and for servers, to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks where an authorized client attempts to connect to another client by impersonating the server.

field.label: Certificate Authority
field.help: Select a certificate authority when it differs from the attached certificate.

field.label: Certificate Revocation List
field.help: Select a certificate revocation list to use for this service.

field.label: Verify Client Certificate
field.help: Specify if the client is required to offer a certificate.

field.label: Use OCSP (when available)
field.help: When the CA used supplies an authorityInfoAccess OCSP URI extension, it will be used to validate the client certificate.

field.label: Certificate Depth
field.help: When a certificate-based client logs in, do not accept certificates below this depth. Useful for denying certificates made with intermediate CAs generated from the same CA as the server.

field.label: TLS static key
field.help: Add an additional layer of HMAC authentication on top of the TLS control channel to mitigate DoS attacks and attacks on the TLS stack. The prefixed mode determines if this measurement is only used for authentication (--tls-auth) or includes encryption (--tls-crypt).

field.label: Auth
field.help: Authenticate data channel packets and (if enabled) tls-auth control channel packets with HMAC using message digest algorithm alg.

field.label: Data Ciphers
field.help: Restrict the allowed ciphers to be negotiated to the ciphers in this list.

field.label: Data Ciphers Fallback
field.help: Configure a cipher that is used to fall back to if we could not determine which cipher the peer is willing to use. This option should only be needed to connect to peers that are running OpenVPN 2.3 or older versions, and have been configured with --enable-small (typically used on routers or other embedded devices).

field.label: Authentication
field.help: Select authentication methods to use, leave empty if no challenge response authentication is needed.

field.label: Enforce local group
field.help: Restrict access to users in the selected local group. Please be aware that other authentication backends will refuse to authenticate when using this option.

field.label: Username as CN
field.help: Use the authenticated username as the common-name, rather than the common-name from the client certificate.

field.label: Strict User/CN Matching
field.help: When authenticating users, enforce a match between the Common Name of the client certificate and the username given at login.

field.label: Username
field.help: (optional) Username to send to the server for authentication when required.

field.label: Password
field.help: Password belonging to the user specified above

field.label: Renegotiate time
field.help: Renegotiate data channel key after n seconds (default=3600). When using a one time password, be advised that your connection will automatically drop because your password is not valid anymore. Set to 0 to disable, remember to change your client as well.

field.label: Auth Token Lifetime
field.help: After successful user/password authentication, the OpenVPN server will with this option generate a temporary authentication token and push that to the client. On the following renegotiations, the OpenVPN client will pass this token instead of the users password. On the server side the server will do the token authentication internally and it will NOT do any additional authentications against configured external user/password authentication mechanisms. When set to 0, the token will never expire, any other value specifies the lifetime in seconds.

field.label: Local Network
field.help: These are the networks accessible on this host, these are pushed via route{-ipv6} clauses in OpenVPN to the client.

field.label: Remote Network
field.help: Remote networks for the server, add route to routing table after connection is established

field.label: Options
field.help: Various less frequently used yes/no options which can be set for this instance.

field.label: Push Options
field.help: Various less frequently used yes/no options which can be pushed to the client for this instance.

field.label: Redirect gateway
field.help: Automatically execute routing commands to cause all outgoing IP traffic to be redirected over the VPN.

field.label: Route-metric (client)
field.help: Specify a default metric m for use with --route on the connecting client (push option).

field.label: Register DNS
field.help: Run ipconfig /flushdns and ipconfig /registerdns on connection initiation. This is known to kick Windows into recognizing pushed DNS servers.

field.label: DNS Default Domain
field.help: Set Connection-specific DNS Suffix.

field.label: DNS Domain search list
field.help: Add name to the domain search list. Repeat this option to add more entries. Up to 10 domains are supported

field.label: DNS Servers
field.help: Set primary domain name server IPv4 or IPv6 address. Repeat this option to set secondary DNS server addresses.

field.label: NTP Servers
field.help: Set primary NTP server address (Network Time Protocol). Repeat this option to set secondary NTP server addresses.

field.label: TUN device MTU
field.help: Take the TUN device MTU to be tun-mtu and derive the link MTU from it.

field.label: Fragment size
field.help: Enable internal datagram fragmentation so that no UDP datagrams are sent which are larger than the specified byte size.

field.label: MSS fix
field.help: Announce to TCP sessions running over the tunnel that they should limit their send packet sizes such that after OpenVPN has encapsulated them, the resulting UDP packet size that OpenVPN sends to its peer will not exceed the recommended size.
